page.title: 15The Dixon Brothers.2.
page.content: Jeremiah and George recieved some of their education from Mr.John Kipling at Barnard Castle and had connections with well_known mathematicians and scientists.Jeremiah Dixon was introduced to The Royal Society by John Bird a mathematical instrument maker.At his interview Jeremiah alleged that he had received his knowledge 'in a pit cabin on Cockfield Fell'.A Fellow of the Royal Society Dixon led an expedition to St.Helena, which resulted in him being chosen with a fellow surveyor,Charles Mason to go to the U.S.A. to survey what was to be known as the Mason_Dixon Line, the boundary between Maryland and Pennsylvania.Jeremiah described George as 'an engineer,geologist,chemist, mathematician,engraver,painter,and planner'.A pioneer of hydraulics and pneumatics he invented gas lighting.
